channel.title: CVE Feed for Jenkins Project -- Jenkins AppSpider Plugin
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Jenkins Project -- Jenkins AppSpider Plugin

item.title: CVE-2023-32998|2024-08-02T15:32:46.561Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20appspider%20plugin
item.description: A cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in Jenkins AppSpider Plugin 1.0.15 and earlier allows attackers to connect to an attacker-specified URL and send an HTTP POST request with a JSON payload consisting of attacker-specified credentials.

item.title: CVE-2023-32999|2024-08-02T15:32:46.746Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20appspider%20plugin
item.description: A missing permission check in Jenkins AppSpider Plugin 1.0.15 and earlier allows attackers with Overall/Read permission to connect to an attacker-specified URL and send an HTTP POST request with a JSON payload consisting of attacker-specified credentials.

item.title: CVE-2024-28155|2024-08-02T00:48:49.350Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20appspider%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins AppSpider Plugin 1.0.16 and earlier does not perform permission checks in several HTTP endpoints, allowing attackers with Overall/Read permission to obtain information about available scan config names, engine group names, and client names.

item.title: CVE-2024-28155|2024-06-04T18:03:13.356Z -- jenkins%20project -- jenkins%20appspider%20plugin
item.description: Jenkins AppSpider Plugin 1.0.16 and earlier does not perform permission checks in several HTTP endpoints, allowing attackers with Overall/Read permission to obtain information about available scan config names, engine group names, and client names.
